FacilityName: Messer Gas Puerto Rico Inc - Cata?o
RMPDescription: Puerto Rico - Anhydrous Ammonia and Chlorine

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility:

The Messer Gas Puerto Rico, Inc. facility located in Catano, Puerto Rico complies with applicable requirements for toxic substances and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal and local laws.  If an emergency accidental release were to occur involving our anhydrous ammonia, it is our policy to immediately notify the Catano Fire Department and the Messer Gas Emergency Response Team, who would respond to the emergency.



2.  A description of the facility and the regulated substances handled:

The Messer Gas Puerto Rico, Inc. facility stores anhydrous ammonia in cylinders and ISO container. The anhydrous ammonia cylinder filling processes are no longer at Messer Gas Puerto Rico Facility. The ammonia ISO container and ammonia cylinders are transported to the facility, stored for a period of time, and then shipped from the facility.



3.  The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:

The Messer Gas Puerto Rico facility complies with USEPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable federal and local codes and regulations.  



4.  Five-year accident history:

The Messer Gas Puerto Rico facility has never had an accident involving its ammonia processes.  



5.  The emergency response program:

In the event of an emergency accidental release involving our covered processes, it is Messer Gas' policy to immediately notify the Catano Fire Department and Messer Gas Puerto Rico Emergency Response Team, who would respond to the emergency.  We have communicated this policy with the Catano Fire Department.  All members of the Messer Gas Puerto Rico Emergency Response Team are properly trained to respond to emergencies at the facility.  All employees have access to Messer Gas' emergency action plan.  Emergency response training is conducted annually.  



6.  Planned changes to improve safety:          Installation of monitors
